item.title: Evolution
item.description:
Initial paths

The evolution of the classical Śrīkula from the Dakṣiṇāmnāya appears to have proceeded along two initial paths.

We believe that one was influenced by the Pūrvāmnāya and its chief deity Parā. This led to the incorporation of the arṇa of Parā, sauḥ, into the central mantra of the cult in the form of the triadic Tripuraśekhara mantra, featuring the Vāgbhava, Kāmakalā, and Parā kūṭa-s.

The other lineage (Śrīvidyā) was influenced by the Paścimāmnāya and used the Pañcadaśī (Ṣoḍaśī) as its primary mantra. The Pañcadaśī can be seen as featuring a “resolved” form of the central mantra-s of Kubjikā and Navātman-bhairava.

item.title: Tripuraśekhara
item.description:
Svacchanda

The lineage of the Śrīkula centered on the trisyllabic Tripuraśekhara is taught in the Nityāṣoḍaśikārṇava section of the Vāmakeśvara-tantra (NS 4.15-18).

tataḥ svacchanda-rūpā tu
paribhramya jagat punaḥ ।
tena cāreṇa saṃtuṣṭā
punar ekākinī satī ॥

Thereafter, verily <taking the form of Svacchanda (Bhairava or his Bhairavī counterpart) | taking any form she wishes>,
again roaming the universe, she then becomes satisfied by these wanderings and again becomes solitary.

One could ask whether the interpretation of Svacchanda-rūpā could be connected to Svacchanda Bhairava.

item.title: दीपकनाथः
item.description:
त्रिपुरा-दण्डकः

One of the daNDaka verses of the siddha dIpakanAtha to the supreme deity of his system, tripurA: Here, it associates the said goddess with the rudra-s of the vowels and the consonants, much like the pUrvAmnaya (trika) tradition.

Further, based on the saundaryalaharI, the phrase “kamala-vana-bhavana-bhUmau” (c.f., S21 mahApadmATavyAm) is taken to cryptically imply the chakra-s.

अ इ उ ऋ ऌ इति लघुतया तद् अनु दैर्घ्येण पञ्चैव योनिस् तथा वाग्भवं प्रणव औ बिन्दुरः क ख ग घ ङ च छ ज झ ञ ट ठ ड ढ ण त थ द ध न प फ ब भ म य र ल व श ष स ह ळेति सुबुद्ध-रुद्रात्मिकाम् अमृतकर-किरण-गण-वर्ष्णीम् मातृकां उद्गिरन्ती हसन्ती लसन्ती वसन्ती सदा तत्र कमल-वन-भवन-भूमौ भवन्ती भव-भेदिनी भय-भञ्जिनी स भूर्-भुवः-स्वर्-भुवन-मूर्ति-भव्ये सुभव्ये सुकाव्ये ॥
